name: Mesh Tools Zero
short_description:
Mesh Tools Zero (MT0 for short) is a set of C++ written libraries designed to interpret (parse) some 3D polygonal mesh formats and cast into a convenient data structure containing information related to geometry, shading, texturing, morphing and skeletal animation, in order to be post-procesing (normal/tangent calculation, morph targets generation, skin weights simplification, and more) or rendered (oriented to OpenGL and GLSL). Polygonal Model Formats handled until now:
-Wavefront (*.obj)
-Direct X (*.x) (only text files)
-Miku Miku Dance (*.pmd) (only version 2)
-Halflife Model (*.smd) (only version 1)
-Metasequoia (*.mqo) (binary data not supported).
Formats to be added in a future
-3D Studio (*.3ds)
The entire project is developed in Borland's C++ Builder 6
